question:
The Government of India has recently decided to set up a new strategic panel called Defence Planning Committee. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The Defence Planning Committee will be chaired by the Defence Secretary
  2. The committee will work on the country's military and security strategy and will also oversee India’s foreign defence acquisitions.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is incorrect</u>. Defence Planning Committee (DPC) will be chaired by National Security Advisor (NSA) and not by the Defence Secretary. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. The committee will work on the country’s military and security strategy and also it aims to oversee foreign acquisitions and sales. The committee will prepare draft reports on \"national security strategy, international defence engagement strategy, roadmap to build defence manufacturing ecosystem, strategy to boost defence exports, and priority capability development plans. The committee will submit its report to the defence minister.
